attributes.action: Reject Home Office proposals to use the RAF Scampton site as a Asylum Centre
attributes.additional_details: West Lindsey District Council voted to acquire the RAF Scampton site & partner with an investor to deliver a regeneration & redevelopment project. The deal, which will secure over £300 million of investment will preserve, protect & enhance the site by providing aviation heritage, business, aerospace, space & aviation technology & education opportunities. The Home Office have recently announced that the site could be used for the accommodation of asylum seekers, for which there is currently no planning permission & which would prevent the realisation of the major redevelopment scheme. The Home Office plan would be catastrophic with far reaching economic & social implications. The Home Office plan would be counter-productive to the Government’s longer-term investment & Levelling Up agenda.
attributes.background: Ministers are urged to remove the former RAF Scampton site from its list of places for an Asylum Centre and keep the agreed regeneration plan in place.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions about operational matters, which includes decisions about what specific government facilities to use to accommodate asylum seekers.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government not to house asylum seekers in any military facilities, if that's something you'd like to happen.
